analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i sa gzhi rnams su khyab cing gnas pa'o //
translated: She pervades and abides in them.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How?

original: tha mal pa ma yin pa'i gzugs kyis bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor bas phyi rol gyi phyag rgya ma ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa ma yin pa'i gzugs kyis bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i sbyor bas phyi rol gyi phyag rgya ma ste /
translated: With a non-ordinary form, through the union of the churning and the churned, she is the external mudra.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is she?

original: bsags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bsags pa med pa ste /
translated: She is not accumulated.

original: gzhan dag gis las ngan pa bsags par gyur @66b pa gang yin pa de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis las ngan pa bsags par gyur @66b pa gang yin pa de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever bad karma is accumulated by others, that does not exist for her.

original: dang po'i don la gsum par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i don la gsum par shes par bya'o //
translated: The third should be understood in terms of the first.

original: de dang lhan cig sgren mo rtag tu nub mo spyad ces bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig sgren mo rtag tu nub mo spyad ces bya bar 'brel to //
translated: She is naked and always practices at night.

original: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //üîΩle'u bzhi bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //üîΩle'u bzhi bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: // / me tog chu ni dus su 'byung ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: // / me tog chu ni dus su 'byung ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The flower is the water that arises in time, and the innate.

original: sngags 'di zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i sngags yi ge bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i sngags yi ge bdun pa'o //
translated: This mantra is the seven-syllable root mantra.

original: de bzhin sbyin zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gsum po rnams la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sbyin zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gsum po rnams la sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving like that is giving to the three wheels.

original: nag mo chen mo ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: nag mo chen mo ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: The great black one is VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´.

original: bden pas tshangs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bden pas tshangs par spyad pa zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The vow of celibacy is having the vow of celibacy.üîΩIf there is no middle, there is no beginning or end.

original: thog mtha' zhes bya ba ni dbus med na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis na thog ma dang dbus dang tha mar bdag nyid dbang du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thog mtha' zhes bya ba ni dbus med na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis na thog ma dang dbus dang tha mar bdag nyid dbang du gyur ba'o //
translated: Since there is no beginning, middle, or end, one is in control of oneself.

original: bzhad pa nyid phyag rgya yin pas na rol cing dgod pa gtso bor gyur pas dga' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzhad pa nyid phyag rgya yin pas na rol cing dgod pa gtso bor gyur pas dga' bar byed pa ste /
translated: Since laughter is a seal, one is delighted by the chief of those who play and laugh.

original: phyag rgya des so //
analyzed: phyag rgya des so //
translated: With that seal.

original: lta ba'i snyems pa yang dag par ston cing snyems pas mthong ba ni snyems pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i snyems pa yang dag par ston cing snyems pas mthong ba ni snyems pa'o //
translated: Showing off one's view is pride. Seeing with pride is arrogance.

original: 'di lta bu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i lha mo ni grags pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i lha mo ni grags pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro /
translated: A goddess who has such distinctions becomes famous.

original: 'dis zhes bya bas ni mo rtags su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya bas ni mo rtags su shes par bya'o //
translated: By this one should understand the female sex organ.

original: bzhad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: bzhad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The laughter is just an illustration.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba thams cad kyang mtshan mo'am nyin mo bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba thams cad kyang mtshan mo'am nyin mo bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: All the bliss of intense joy should be done at night or during the day, one should add.

original: gzugs dang las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa pos mthong ba dang grub pa'i lha mo rnams sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs dang bya ba dag ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs dang las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa pos mthong ba dang grub pa'i lha mo rnams sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs dang bya ba dag ston par byed de /
translated: The form and action and so forth are the previously unseen forms and actions of the accomplished goddesses that the adept sees.

original: de'i las dang las kyi lan bstan pa ni gar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te lha mo'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i las dang las kyi lan bstan pa ni gar dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te lha mo'i bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of their action and the response to that action is dance and so forth, which are the actions of the goddesses.

original: rdo rje la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa po'i bya ba'o //
translated: The vajra and so forth are the actions of the adept.

original: dbugs 'byin zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sigh is the absence of movement, that is the meaning.

original: sgeg dang zhes bya ba ni gar gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgeg dang zhes bya ba ni gar gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The play is a special dance.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs kyi bdag mo'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs kyi bdag mo'o //
translated: The variety is the mistress of the variety.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i las so //
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i las so //
translated: The first is the rite of accomplishment.

original: ha ha zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi las te /
analyzed: ha ha zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi las te /
translated: The ha ha is the rite of others,

original: sngar bshad pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis bya ba'o //
translated: and it is to be done by the very process explained above.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: le'u bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER XLIV

original: // / bzhi po zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes kyi sngags kyis so //
analyzed: // / bzhi po zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes kyi sngags kyis so //
translated: The four are the mantra of Sumbha.

original: gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa 'di rnams shin tu gsang ba yin par bstan to //üîΩsnyim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub @67a * //
analyzed: gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa 'di rnams shin tu gsang ba yin par bstan to // snyim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub @67a * //
translated: The etc. indicates that these offerings are very secret.

original: pa po'i nus pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma ston pa yin te /
analyzed: pa po'i nus pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma ston pa yin te /
translated: The palms and so forth indicate the signs of all the powers of the adept.

original: gang gi tshe gsang sngags mngon par bzlas nas me tog nam mkha' la gtor la de las me tog gcig kyang la mi ltung na de'i tshe las thams cad kyang byed par nus so zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsang sngags mngon par bzlas nas me tog nam mkha' la gtor la de las me tog gcig kyang la mi ltung na de'i tshe las thams cad kyang byed par nus so zhes bya ba rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: When one has recited the mantra and thrown flowers into the sky, and not a single flower falls to the ground, at that time one is able to perform all activities.

original: lha dang mi yis mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lha dang mi yis mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: One will not be seen by gods or humans.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams kyis kyang phyed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams kyis kyang phyed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that one will not be perceived even by gods and humans.

original: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yi ge bdun pa'i sngags kyis sngon du bsnyen pa byas pas cho ga du ma dag bstan pa yin te /üîΩdus min 'chi dang bcom dang nyams //
analyzed: shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yi ge bdun pa'i sngags kyis sngon du bsnyen pa byas pas cho ga du ma dag bstan pa yin te / dus min 'chi dang bcom dang nyams //
translated: The seven syllables mantra, having performed the preliminary practice, the many ritual procedures are taught by the verse beginning with ‚Äútree‚Äù and so on.üîΩOne will remove untimely death, destruction, and decline.

original: zhes bya ba las dus ma yin par 'chi ba sel bar 'gyur zhing tshe 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba las dus ma yin par 'chi ba sel bar 'gyur zhing tshe 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: From this, untimely death is removed and one‚Äôs lifespan is extended.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pra se na'i cho ga ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pra se na'i cho ga ston to //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on teaches the ritual of prasena.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nad zhi ba'i cho ga ston te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nad zhi ba'i cho ga ston te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúalternatively‚Äù and so on teaches the ritual for curing illness.

original: yi ge bdun pa'i sngags bsgom pa'am lan brgya bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge bdun pa'i sngags bsgom pa'am lan brgya bzlas pa'o //
translated: One should meditate on the mantra of the seven syllables or repeat it a hundred times.

original: nyi ma'i dbus su mngon sum du bsam par byas te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dbus su mngon sum du bsam par byas te /
translated: One should visualize it directly in the center of the sun.

original: de la nad kyis gzir ba'i nad pa bzhag la yang lan stong gi bar du bzlas la /
analyzed: de la nad kyis gzir ba'i nad pa bzhag la yang lan stong gi bar du bzlas la /
translated: One should place the patient who is afflicted with disease there and repeat it a thousand times.

original: de'i lus shel ltar dri ma med par bsams na ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lus shel ltar dri ma med par bsams na ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one visualizes his body as stainless like crystal, it will be as stated.

original: yang 'dra ba zhes smos pas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyi snying gar mthe bo tsam gyi tshad la shel ltar dang ba'i 'od zer 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bsams na nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'dra ba zhes smos pas bsgrub par bya ba de nyid kyi snying gar mthe bo tsam gyi tshad la shel ltar dang ba'i 'od zer 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bsams na nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by the mention of ‚Äúlike‚Äù that very object of attainment, one should visualize the nature of consciousness, the size of a thumb, blazing with clear light like crystal, in the heart. One will be free from disease.

original: ston ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dug bsal ba'i cho ga ston to //
analyzed: ston ka'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dug bsal ba'i cho ga ston to //
translated: By ‚Äúautumn‚Äù and so on, he teaches the rite for removing poison.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gzugs lnga zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gzugs lnga zhes bya ba la //
translated: ‚ÄúFive forms‚Äù and so on.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re'u mig lngar byas pa la re'u mig dgu ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re'u mig lngar byas pa la re'u mig dgu ru 'gyur te /
translated: The moon ma·πá·∏çala is made into five squares, becoming nine squares.

original: de la 'di ltar bkod na 'di sa rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dug gis zin pa'i mgor bzhag la /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar bkod na 'di sa rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dug gis zin pa'i mgor bzhag la /
translated: If one arranges it like this, one should place it on the head of someone bitten by a poisonous or non-poisonous snake.

original: de nas bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas lus thams cad du dug med par bsams na nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas lus thams cad du dug med par bsams na nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by the stream of nectar falling, one imagines that the whole body is free of poison, and one will become free of disease.

original: de bzhin du rims la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyang bsal bar bya ba zhing rang nyid kyis bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa yang spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rims la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyang bsal bar bya ba zhing rang nyid kyis bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa yang spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
translated: In the same way, one should remove fevers and other diseases, and one should also use the food, drink, etc. oneself. This is the instruction.

original: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: 'khor lo 'di nyid lag pa'i mthil du bsams la bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo la bzhag na yang snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di nyid lag pa'i mthil du bsams la bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo la bzhag na yang snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines this wheel on the palm of one's hand and places it on the head of the one to be accomplished, it will be as before.

original: le'u bzhi bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: Chapter 43

analyzed: // / gtsang ma'i 'o ma zhes bya ba @67b ni ba'i 'o ma'o //
translated: The pure milk is cow's milk.

original: le'u bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o /

original: // / rta gsod pa ni ka ra b'i ra'o //
analyzed: // / rta gsod pa ni ka ra b'i ra'o //
translated: The horse killer is the karavƒ´ra.

original: skye gnas rgya bcings pa zhes bya ba ni phyi'i lha mo dang kha sbyor gyi sbyor ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye gnas rgya bcings pa zhes bya ba ni phyi'i lha mo dang kha sbyor gyi sbyor ba bya ba'o //
translated: The binding of the womb is the practice of union with the external goddess.

original: spra tshil gyis kyang rab tu byug / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: spra tshil gyis kyang rab tu byug / ces bya ba ni /

original: 'dir spra tshil las gzugs brnyan byas la /
analyzed: 'dir spra tshil las gzugs brnyan byas la /

original: tsandan dmar po'i phye ma dang / tsha ba gsum gyi lde gus byug //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po'i phye ma dang / tsha ba gsum gyi lde gus byug //
translated: Anoint with red sandalwood powder and the paste of the three spices.

original: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus it is applied.

original: le'u bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
translated: Chapter XLIVüîΩThe five letters ha

original: // / yi ge ha ni lnga po dang // lag pa kun du mnyes nas ni //
analyzed: // / yi ge ha ni lnga po dang // lag pa kun du mnyes nas ni //
translated: and rubbing all over with the hands,

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gi rkang rjes kyi rdul khrag dang / dug dang / ske tshes la lag pa gnyis kyi mthil bskus la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gi rkang rjes kyi rdul khrag dang / dug dang / ske tshes la lag pa gnyis kyi mthil bskus la /
translated: one should smear the palms of both hands with the dust from the feet of a corpse, blood, poison, and mustard seed.üîΩOn top of that, one should write the five letters ha

original: de'i steng du ba bla'i snag tsha dang bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gus yi ge lnga /
analyzed: de'i steng du ba bla'i snag tsha dang bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gus yi ge lnga /
translated: with crow-feather pen and soot from a funeral pyre.

original: hem hha // hoo ho bris la bsam gtan gyis kyang de ltar bsams la seng ldeng gi me mdag gam /
analyzed: hem hha // hoo ho bris la bsam gtan gyis kyang de ltar bsams la seng ldeng gi me mdag gam /
translated: One should visualize that with concentration, and with the embers of a cutch tree,

original: ro bsregs pa'i me mdag la lag pa gnyis nyed cing sbyin sreg byas na dgra bo'i kha nas khrag 'dzag cing mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i me mdag la lag pa gnyis nyed cing sbyin sreg byas na dgra bo'i kha nas khrag 'dzag cing mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one burns one's two hands in the embers of the cremation fire, and makes burnt offerings, then the enemy will bleed from the mouth and die immediately.

original: thod pa la sogs pa la yang sbyor ba de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: thod pa la sogs pa la yang sbyor ba de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should perform the rite in the same way with a skull, etc.

original: byi la la sogs pa'i sha kha na ma tho ba med pas rnyed pa ni mkha' 'gro ma dgyes par bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩyang yi ge bdun pa'i yi ge re re zhing bzlas brjod 'bum gyi grangs tshad mar mngon par bzla bar bya zhing dang por sreg blugs gsum byas la phyis stong rtsa brgyad bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

translated: The text says cat, etc., in order to teach that one should please the qakinis with meat that is free from moral defilement, such as cat meat.

original: le'u bzhi bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu drug pa'o /
translated: Moreover, one should consecrate each syllable of the seven-syllable mantra with the recitation of one hundred thousand times, and first make three burnt offerings, and then one should apply the recitation of one thousand and eight times.

original: // / rab tu rtogs pa ni mi shi ba'o //
analyzed: // / rab tu rtogs pa ni mi shi ba'o //
translated: Complete understanding is death.

original: gnam lcags ni lcags kyi zegs ma'o //
analyzed: gnam lcags ni lcags kyi zegs ma'o //

original: ka ka aanti ka'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: ka ka aanti ka'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The fruit of the kakkola is the fruit of the betel-nut palm.

original: shing gandho pa la'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: shing gandho pa la'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The fruit of the Gandhapala tree.

original: ne'u le'i spyi bor zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa'i kha na ma tho ba med par rnyed pa'i thod pa'i nang du rgya skyegs dang gur gum dang lhan cig phye mar byas la ji ltar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du cho ga'o //

translated: On the top of a cat's head, in the skull of one who has been found without the sin of killing, one should grind together lac and saffron, and do as previously stated.

original: gser gyi 'bras bu ni dha du ra'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gser gyi 'bras bu ni dha du ra'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The golden fruit is the fruit of the Dhattura plant.

original: bya chen po'i gnas ni 'ug pa'i tshang ngo //
analyzed: bya chen po'i gnas ni 'ug pa'i tshang ngo //
translated: The great bird's nest is the owl's nest.

original: rgyus pa ni chu rgyus so //
analyzed: rgyus pa ni chu rgyus so //
translated: The sinew is the sinew of the neck.

original: 'bru ni 'bras sam 'u su'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩle'u bzhi bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: 'bru ni 'bras sam 'u su'i 'bras bu'o // le'u bzhi bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: The grain is rice or Ushira grain.üîΩThen, etc.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yum gyi snying po'i sngags ston pa'o //üîΩri bo bzang po @68a * //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yum gyi snying po'i sngags ston pa'o // ri bo bzang po @68a * //
translated: The Bhagavat's heart mantra of the Mother is taught.

original: bri bya zhing //
analyzed: bri bya zhing //
translated: One should draw the excellent mountain.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang / rus sbal dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / sna tshogs pad ma'i steng du gser gyi ri bdun gyis yongs su bskor ba'i ri'i rgyal po ri rab bsams te /üîΩde'i steng du 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i rim pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor dang / rus sbal dang / sna tshogs rdo rje dang / sna tshogs pad ma'i steng du gser gyi ri bdun gyis yongs su bskor ba'i ri'i rgyal po ri rab bsams te / de'i steng du 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i rim pa ston te /
translated: This is the wind, fire, water, and earth mandalas, the tortoise, the vajra cross, and the variegated lotus, upon which is the king of mountains, Mount Meru, surrounded by the seven golden mountains.üîΩüîΩThe process of perfecting the three wheels and so forth is taught.üîΩ

original: ha ha he he zhes bya ba ni lha'i nga rgyal gyis sngags chen po'i bshad pa ston te //
analyzed: ha ha he he zhes bya ba ni lha'i nga rgyal gyis sngags chen po'i bshad pa ston te //
translated: This is the teaching of the great mantra with the pride of the deity.

original: de nas dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i mtshan go bzlog pa'i tshul gyis ston to //
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i mtshan go bzlog pa'i tshul gyis ston to //
translated: Then, the names of the twenty-four heroes are taught in the reverse order.

original: 'jigs byed ni 'jigs byed chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed ni 'jigs byed chen po'o //

original: b'i ri na ni su ra b'i ri na'o //
analyzed: b'i ri na ni su ra b'i ri na'o //

original: ka ta zhes bya ba ni ma h'a kam ka la'o //
analyzed: ka ta zhes bya ba ni ma h'a kam ka la'o //

original: bya ba kun la sgrub pa pos //
analyzed: bya ba kun la sgrub pa pos //

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad la las dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor lo gsum dang ldan pa'i sngags pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad la las dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor lo gsum dang ldan pa'i sngags pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: This means that the mantrin who possesses the three wheels that are in accordance with the rite should accomplish all rites such as pacification and enrichment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lor bzhugs pa zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lor bzhugs pa zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'khor lo chen po zhes bya ba ni gang la 'khor lo chen po'i tshogs mnga' bde la de skad ces bya ste bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The great wheel is the one who possesses the assembly of the great wheel, that is, the BhagavƒÅn.

original: yang na chen po'i 'khor lo gsum gang la mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na chen po'i 'khor lo gsum gang la mnga' ba'o //
translated: Or, it is the one who possesses the three great wheels.

original: yang na chen po yang yin la 'khor lo yang yin pas 'khor lo chen po ste 'khor lo gsum po nyid do //
analyzed: yang na chen po yang yin la 'khor lo yang yin pas 'khor lo chen po ste 'khor lo gsum po nyid do //
translated: Or, it is the great wheel because it is both great and a wheel, that is, the three wheels.

original: le'u bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
translated: The forty-eighth chapter.

original: da ni de nas zhes pa la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i phyugs sgrub pa de'i kha bskang pa ston pa yin te /

translated: Now, from ‚ÄúThen,‚Äù and so forth, it teaches the supplement to the previously explained animal sacrifice.

original: de ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka nyid du bskyed pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka nyid du bskyed pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: That is to say, it is the generation of the Blessed One, ≈örƒ´ Heruka, himself.

original: le'u bzhi bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER XLIX

original: // / go m'am sa la sogs pas dbang du bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ni sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: // / go m'am sa la sogs pas dbang du bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ni sngar bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The rite of subjugating the earth, etc., with the goad, etc., should be done according to the rite explained previously.

original: kha chu ni bad kan no //
analyzed: kha chu ni bad kan no //
translated: Saliva is phlegm.

original: so shing ni de nyid do //
analyzed: so shing ni de nyid do //
translated: A tooth stick is that very thing.

original: rang gi lus zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'am 'dug pa'am gnyid log pa'am ma log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du yang sngags pas gsang sngags bzla bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi lus zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'am 'dug pa'am gnyid log pa'am ma log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du yang sngags pas gsang sngags bzla bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One's own body means that the mantrin should recite the mantra in all situations, whether walking, standing, sleeping, or not sleeping, and so on.

original: dus kyi nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi nges pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no fixed time.

original: sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar //
analyzed: sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar //
translated: Up to one hundred and eight fire sacrifices.

original: zhes bya ba ni aarka'i yam shing dang rgyas pa'i cho gas zla ba gcig gi bar du sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad rtag par byas na dbul ba thams cad 'jig par byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni aarka'i yam shing dang rgyas pa'i cho gas zla ba gcig gi bar du sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad rtag par byas na dbul ba thams cad 'jig par byed do zhes ston to //
translated: This teaches that if one always performs one hundred and eight fire sacrifices with arka sticks and the rite of increase for one month, all poverty is destroyed.

original: @68b gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
analyzed: @68b gzhan dag ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the state of moving in space.

original: zhes bya ba ni so sor snang ba thob par gyur ba'i sngags pas thun gnyis kyi bar du mnyam par gzhag la sbyin sreg byas na lha thams cad kyi dam tshig thob par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so sor snang ba thob par gyur ba'i sngags pas thun gnyis kyi bar du mnyam par gzhag la sbyin sreg byas na lha thams cad kyi dam tshig thob par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that the reciter who has attained the individual appearances should perform the burnt offerings for two watches while in equipoise, and will attain the commitments of all the deities.

original: go ma yu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: go ma yu zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the case of the phrase ‚Äúgom≈´trikƒÅ,‚Äù

original: wa'i sha kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed pa dang / myos byed ces bya ba chang gi sbyin sreg dang / gtor ma la sogs pa byas shing bzlas brjod byas na mtshan mo khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: wa'i sha kha na ma tho ba med pa rnyed pa dang / myos byed ces bya ba chang gi sbyin sreg dang / gtor ma la sogs pa byas shing bzlas brjod byas na mtshan mo khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should understand that if one performs the burnt offerings of the meat of a mongoose, which is free of moral defilement, and the burnt offerings of the intoxicant, which is beer, and the bali offerings, etc., and recites the mantra, it will be especially effective at night.

original: gtor ma dang las dang sngags zlos pas byas nas gang gi nub mo ce sbyang gi sha ji ltar rnyed pa bza'o //
analyzed: gtor ma dang las dang sngags zlos pas byas nas gang gi nub mo ce sbyang gi sha ji ltar rnyed pa bza'o //
translated: One should perform the bali offering, the rite, and the recitation of the mantra, and eat the meat of a mongoose at night, as much as one can get.

original: bil ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin rgyas pa'i cho ga bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bil ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin rgyas pa'i cho ga bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the phrase ‚Äúbilva,‚Äù etc., one should understand that one should perform the prosperity rite as before.

original: go m'am sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: go m'am sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words goma and sa are easy to understand.

original: go ma yu zhes bya ba wa'i sha'i sbyin sreg yang dang yang du smos pa ni sbyin sreg 'di nyid 'bras bu lhag par che bar ston to //
analyzed: go ma yu zhes bya ba wa'i sha'i sbyin sreg yang dang yang du smos pa ni sbyin sreg 'di nyid 'bras bu lhag par che bar ston to //
translated: The repeated mention of the oblation of dog meat in the phrase gomayu shows that this oblation has an especially great result.

original: brtul zhugs gtsang sbra med na yang //
analyzed: brtul zhugs gtsang sbra med na yang //
translated: Even without the purity of observances,

analyzed: bstan pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one will attain the power of the teaching.

original: phyi'i brtul zhugs la spyod pa yang med la phyi'i gtsang sbra med du zin kyang tshul 'di bzhin du spyod pa'i rnal 'byor ba la lha rnams kyis bstan pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: phyi'i brtul zhugs la spyod pa yang med la phyi'i gtsang sbra med du zin kyang tshul 'di bzhin du spyod pa'i rnal 'byor ba la lha rnams kyis bstan pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that even though one does not practice the external observances and does not have the external purity, the gods will grant the power of the teaching to the yogi who practices in this way.

original: lhag pa'i tsher 'gyur ba ni tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tsher 'gyur ba ni tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase will have superior life means that one will have limitless life.

original: kusmandam zhes bya ba bum sha'i sa bon dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang tsa na ka dang spra tshil te sbrang rtsi'i tshigs ma dang / ske tshe dang / ta ma la'i lo ma cha mnyam par byas te /üîΩgang gi don du bya ba'i ming nas smos te /

translated: Kusmanda means the seeds of the gourd, the seeds of the black gram, the seeds of the white gram, the seeds of the chickpea, and the seeds of the honey tree, and also black mustard, and the leaves of the tamala tree, all in equal parts.

original: sngags kyis bskul la de'i khang ba'i phyogs gcig tu bskus na ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
